conditions.weatherComment:

Take off & Landings & other vulnerable areas will be covered with frost sheets.

conditions.weatherComment:
5mm of rain throughout the weekend however it was very windy Sunday.
Turned a bit cooler today with temps down to -0.5c Mon morn. As result a very slight frost. Forecast suggests temps today will getup to +4c with sunshine most of daylight hrs with a moderate westerly wind. Temps this eve May drop to 0c atvworst. Likely to see upwards of 3mm of rain on Tues during racing. Keeping a close eye but things looking good. Could ease a fraction further during racing.
Take off & Landings & other vulnerable areas will be covered with frost sheets.

data.weather: 5.5mm rain last Saturday. Cold, dry and very windy on Sunday. Cold & overcast on Monday. 3mm rain on Tuesday lunchtime. Overnight frost of between -3C & -4C  on Wednesday AM. Clear and sunny day on Wednesday, max 4C. Low of -6C on Thursday AM. Shrouded in Fog all day Thurs, with a high so far of -2C. Below freezing all night on Thursday, ranging from -4C to -1C. Dusting of snow as well. Forecast does not indicate sufficient rise in temperature to shift the frost out the ground.
data.other: Head Groundsman: Ian Ward (07880 722586)

Low of -3.5 overnight, currently -1.5. Temps set to warm up from around 10.00 this morning to daytime high of +6, +4 this eve and +9 on Sunday. Rain also forecast for Sunday p.m/Mon a.m, 6-10mm forecast.
